docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 16 (AP). -- Five members of the crew of the French liner Eubee were drowned but 178 passengers and 36 others in the crew were saved by the British freighter Corinaldo, with which the French ship Collided early Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 16 (AP). -- Five members of the crew of the French liner Eubee were drowned but 178 passengers and 36 others in the crew were saved by the British freighter Corinaldo, with which the French ship Collided early Friday.
docs.abstract: Eubee sinks; 5 of crew drown, 2 passengers hurt; Corinaldo reaches Montevideo, Uruguay

headline.main: 5 DROWNED, 214 SAVED AFTER CRASH OF SHIPS; British Vessel Reaches Uruguay With the 178 Passengers and Crew of French Liner Eubee.

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Aug. 16. -- The eleventh modern Olympic meet came to a picturesque close tonight under the floodlights of the great stadium with a huge choir singing Beethoven melodies, with trumpets sounding its knell, with a battery firing a farewell...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Aug. 16. -- The eleventh modern Olympic meet came to a picturesque close tonight under the floodlights of the great stadium with a huge choir singing Beethoven melodies, with trumpets sounding its knell, with a battery firing a farewell salute and a crowd far exceeding 100,000, the seating capacity of the big bowl, joining in the final chorus and linking arms in a typical burst of German sentiment.

headline.main: Olympic Flame Is Extinguished in Picturesque, Ceremony Under Floodlights; GAMES IN BERLIN CLOSE AMID POMP

docs.snippet: Uruguay suggests meeting at Wash of all Amer govts to offer mediation
docs.abstract: Uruguay suggests meeting at Wash of all Amer govts to offer mediation

headline.main: Uruguay Asks Americas To Be Mediators in Spain

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Aug. 17 (AP). -- During the first half of 1936 Germany tried to square up trade accounts with the United States, and 19,000,000 marks were lopped off the traditional unfavorable trade balance, a report today showed. The balance now stands at...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Aug. 17 (AP). -- During the first half of 1936 Germany tried to square up trade accounts with the United States, and 19,000,000 marks were lopped off the traditional unfavorable trade balance, a report today showed. The balance now stands at 50,900,000 marks, instead of 70,000,000 as at the end of 1935.

headline.main: REICH CUTS DEFICIT IN TRADE WITH U.S.; German Exports Generally Rise 14.3 Per Cent in 1936 -- Biggest Gains in Latin Americas.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18. -- The note from Uruguay suggesting mediation by the Pan-American governments in the Spanish civil war was received by the State Department today from Jose Richling, the Uruguayan Minister here, and was taken under consideration.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18. -- The note from Uruguay suggesting mediation by the Pan-American governments in the Spanish civil war was received by the State Department today from Jose Richling, the Uruguayan Minister here, and was taken under consideration.
docs.abstract: U S State Dept gets Uruguay note; Barcelona and Madrid reptd normal; further evacuation of Amers by Quincy and Okla; lists; member of Amer colony in Madrid praises U S Embassy and consular service in capital; Cuba gets Uruguay note; Sen Casanova asks Cuban Govt to recognize Rebel govt at Burgos

headline.main: WASHINGTON GETS MEDIATION PLEA; But State Department Remains Silent on Uruguay's Plan to Intervene in Spanish War. HEARS MADRID IS QUIET Barcelona Also Is Reported Approaching Normalcy -- 75 Americans Land in France.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: United States Government bonds resumed yesterday their upward course on the New York Stock Exchange as nine of the long-term obligations reached new high levels since their issuance. In the meantime, other higher-grade issues maintained a firm...
docs.lead_paragraph: United States Government bonds resumed yesterday their upward course on the New York Stock Exchange as nine of the long-term obligations reached new high levels since their issuance. In the meantime, other higher-grade issues maintained a firm undertone, while speculative interest in the lower-priced corporate loans showed signs of reviving,

headline.main: NEW HIGH LEVELS IN FEDERAL BONDS; Nine Issues Set Price Records as Group Resumes Rise on Stock Exchange. CORPORATE LOANS FIRM Foreign Obligations Mixed -- Movement Irregular in Trading on Curb.
